elements.title: Angel of Long Point (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Angel of Long Point (pictured) saved seventeen lives across five different incidents?

elements.title: water buffalo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aboriginal Australians who first saw herds of water buffalo interpreted the new animals as a manifestation of their dreaming?

elements.title: Carl Borgmann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the departure of Carl Borgmann from the University of Vermont ended 17 years of scientists serving consecutive terms as president?

elements.title: Lyttelton Gaol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the walls of the former Lyttelton Gaol are archaeologically significant as one of the first uses of concrete in New Zealand?

elements.title: Aileen Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aileen Davies sang roles on the first two D'Oyly Carte Opera Company recordings using the new electrical-recording technology?

elements.title: Kikwit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the city of Kikwit, estimated to have a population of at least half a million, had only four paved roads in 2023?

elements.title: Ed McCann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ed McCann chose a career in civil engineering after being dissuaded from other branches of engineering by their military applications?

elements.title: Naboth Manzongo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, after moving to Canada to work as a priest, Naboth Manzongo did not see his wife and children in Zimbabwe for three years due to COVID-19–related processing delays?

elements.title: Pink Floyd (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pink Floyd escaped from its enclosure at the Sedgwick County Zoo in 2005, but continued to be spotted in Texas as late as 2023?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Parahyangan

The West Javanese region centred around Java's third largest city of Bandung is an excellent place to hike and admire active volcanoes.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
